info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 4:52PM PDT until August 25 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
At 452 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Imperial County
This includes CA Route 78 near mile marker 1...and near mile marker 10...and between mile markers 2 and 9.
This includes the following streams and drainages... San Felipe Creek, Tarantula Wash, Fish Creek Wash, Carrizo Wash and Gert Wash.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL IMPERIAL COUNTY
